chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jacob A Karolczak in court.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Jacob A Karolczak.  Prosecuting attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defendant has been deemed eligible for treatment court. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob A Karolczak in court.  Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court for Jacob A Karolczak.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case is calendared for a plea and sentencing. Defense is pursuing treatment court. All conditions of bail remain as previously ordered. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jacob A Karolczak in court.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lamke not in court. Case is calendared for a plea hearing. Case is adjourned for reasons stated on the record.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jacob A Karolczak in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Jacob A Karolczak in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.

11:27 AM Defendant Jacob A Karolczak in person court with Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke who appears by video.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Lamke has been unable to get in contact with his client. Parties have exchanged telephone numbers. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with RAH; CJH (RAH Wife); LP (RAH Daugher)

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  
No driving without a valid license.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jacob A Karolczak in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Jacob A Karolczak in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jacob A Karolczak appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
